comment.author: 39839593@N00
comment._content: This building is known as the "Kleine Sikkel" (Small Sickle). The address is 2 Nederpolder, but that street continues to become Hoogpoort (Rue Haut-Port) to the right. The building was restored in 1912, when it got this mediaeval gable. The origins of the building go back to the beginnings of the 13th century. Today it is an office of the City of Ghent. See this page (in Dutch): www.gent.be/eCache/THE/1/464.cmVjPTQ0MTgx.html And the present-day view courtesy of Google Streetview. And a picture of 2010:

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: Michiel2005: You have been to a great help, giving us all this information about the building in our photo and its location, as well as posting the recent photo by Erf-goed.be With this new information, our photo gets its full value, Thanks to you! :) I found this information in English: www4.gent.be/gent/english/monument/kleine%20sikkel/sikkel... /Anna B.
